channel.title: Things you DON'T want to see in BM.
channel.description:
Yeah yeah yeah, we've read 'em all; things we WANT in Black Mesa. Helmets, mirrors, retcon character references, etc. in the last several months i don't think there's been any suggestions posted that haven't been posted before.
So i propose we start a new fantasy list : [b]Things you [i]DON'T[/i] want in Black Mesa![/b]
---
- in the opening chapters if the game, if i hear any scientist ask, "Having fun yet, Gordon?" i'm going to lose it. Everybody says this to the newest hire in EVERY job. i don't care if you're stocking freight at your local Wal-Mart or managing a small team of production assistants, at every job there's always one jackoff that asks, "Having fun yet", every. freaking. day.
- Fourth-wall breaking wordage regarding "health", "guns", "pressing USE keys" or any other jargon commonly read in videogame manuals, tutorials or out-of-game discussion. Real world references like Metal Gear Solid ARE FiNE! i just don't want the 'wall broken by accident a la Episode:Two.
- Every GoldSource game had the same stock sound effects for PC movement. Footstep sounds were terrible in the original Half-Life and thanks to the popularity of CounterStrike, i came to HATE the sound of boots on gravel. No matter what surface Gordon's boots touch, it either crumbles beneath the weight of his feet ( [i]*CRUNCH* *crunch* *CRUNCH* *crunch*[/i] ) or -[i]oddly enough[/i]- squeaks and creeks. Either the tiles of Black Mesa's floors are affixed to their foundation with springs or their maintenance staff needs to switch to a thicker floor wax. A quick sprint across the hall always sounds like a college basketball game. if Gordon's feet are going to squeak that much, i want to turn around to see some black sole marks! Thank God this is the Source Engine.
- if guards and HECU are supposed to be weapons experts, make them SOUND like it. There's a clear and obvious difference between, "[url='https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magazine_(firearms)#What_to_call_it.3F']magazines[/url]" and "[url='https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clip_(ammunition)']clips[/url]". That being said, i AM NOT A WEAPONS EXPERT, nut, fanatic, enthusiast or collector . i don't even own a real gun and i know the difference. Hollywood ALWAYS screws this up. Please please PUH-LEASE get it right in Black Mesa.
---
Obviously the game's been in production for a while, it should be out soon and it's way too late to start removing features and the like from the game. Nobody should expect any of this to be taken seriously. it's a list of items to post, discuss and pass the time. A list of realistic expectations. A list of off-the-wall annoyances. A list for the hopeful, the impatient and the totally bored.
Have fun and feel free to post anything.
-Kawai Tei-

item.title: Things you DON'T want to see in BM.
item.dc:creator: XenoSpyro
item.description:
Maxey:

you do need some special renderer or something like that to run DF2 properly on modern machines. Google it.

Still no. Unless my shitty computer is just special and can play old ass games without alot of compatibility issues.

item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
XenoSpyro:

I don’t recall DF2 ever needing any DOS drivers to run O_o

Whoops, you’re right. For some reason I thought it was still a 2.5D game.

Anyway, you do need some special renderer or something like that to run DF2 properly on modern machines. Google it.

item.title: Things you DON'T want to see in BM.
item.dc:creator: Kaweebo
item.description:
Bloodshot:

That’s kinda funny, I got DF2 running flawlessly in Win7 even before patching, with hardware acceleration and 1680x1050 resolution.

Pretty surprising it supports that res actually.


joo must be keeding aren’chyoo

Read full topic
item.source: Things you DON'T want to see in BM.

item.title: Things you DON'T want to see in BM.
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
Kaweebo:

I try getting Jedi Outcast to work properly at 1366X768 resolution, and struggle getting Dark Forces II to run at all. I’d say Half-Life is pretty up to date in being able to play on modern computers, at least from Steam. Especially at highest resolutions.

That’s kinda funny, I got DF2 running flawlessly in Win7 even before patching, with hardware acceleration and 1680x1050 resolution.

Pretty surprising it supports that res actually.

Yeah on topic, I don’t want to see references to stupid BM forum conversations as easter eggs.

Read full topic

Kaweebo:

and struggle getting Dark Forces II to run at all.

Works for me. I use Hardware Accel 16bit mode. Try that?

item.title: Things you DON'T want to see in BM.
item.dc:creator: Power_Dust
item.description:
Just because Windows Vista and/or Windows 7 aren’t mentioned in the system requirements doesn’t mean that Half-Life won’t run on those systems, you can run almost any game on newer ones. I even played the very first Prince of Persia on Windows XP although it was developed for MS-DOS. So buy it, it will work.

Read full topic

item.title: Things you DON'T want to see in BM.
item.dc:creator: Eion_Kilant_739
item.description:
I’ve been thinking about this for some time now. What I expect from this mod is Half-Life, but not just Half-Life. I expect a Half-Life that I can be Immersed in. The original Half-Life was just too outdated for me to truly appreciate the game.

As for easter eggs, I’d actualy be a bit dissapointed if the game only had a few. I couldn’t blame them though, it’s not a priority… What would be great though is a scientist saying “It will be done when it’s done!” to a colleague.

Read full topic
